title: Ticket #1261: rc5des.exe reported as infected by multiple virus scan engines
description:
The msconfig/installer/examples/rc5/rc5des.exe is flagged as potentially infected by several virus scan engines. Furthermore there doesn't seem to be any local source maintained for this in the Condor code base. Recommend removal and replacement with something less contentious.

Results here: http://www.virustotal.com/analisis/cc25b28b8e9e2bd213c90a83e692e329deb349af04c13e7b5b4c7a1b23cfb89b-1265622938
remarks:
2010-Mar-04 15:35:41 by tannenba:
So while some engines flag it, note it isn't actually infected per se.... some engines just flag the rc5 cracker as possible infection, period.

But at any rate I agree w/ the suggested resolution, esp since the RSA challenge (which rc5des.exe worked to crack) expired back in 2007.

My plan is to simply nuke this example for the next release.

2010-Mar-05 17:05:44 by tannenba:
Changes pushed to V7_4-branch. Resolving.
check_ins: 2010-Mar-05 17:00   Check-in [17399]: Remove ancient distributed.net rc5des example from Windows package (#1261) (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: pmackinn
